content: or 30 dcs over the hair elastic depending on the size of the hair elastic so 6 repeat steps 4 and 5 eight times that the entire elastic is covered slip_stitch into the first double_crochet skip the 2 chain 7 double_crochet in each of the last 2 dcs if 20 dcs were made skip the first two rounds of the basic beanie pattern 8 slip_stitch into the stndst from step 1 stitch count 80 if 30 dcs were made skip the first three rounds of the basic beanie pattern work the remaining rounds of either the basic beanie pattern or any of the variants as finishing round optional preferred sltst as per basic beanie pattern or for a ribbed brim beanie as per image 5 work the following steps if the brim feels pattern support/ follow me too loose either go down a hook size or loosen your gauge 1 chain 7 then half_double_crochet in third chain from hook pattern support is available via the following social media platforms 2 half_double_crochet in the remaining four chains 3 slip_stitch into stitch one stitch anticlockwise along the edge of the beanie from the  instagram thecrochetfix stitch that the chain 7 originated from  facebook thecrochetfix 4 sltst one further stitch anticlockwise  ravelry thecrochetfix 5 turn work and then fphdc into each of the 5 half_double_crochet from steps 1 and 2 do not  youtube channel the crochet fix @ chain before commencing fphdc 6 turn work chain 14 and then fphdc around each of the 5 hdcs uchf_xzxo5jju4kdzbfhntba 7 slip_stitch into stitch one stitch anticlockwise along the edge of the beanie from the please help keep my patterns free by following me on the various social media stitch that the slip_stitch in step 4 was made platforms above and subscribing to my feeds 8 sltst one further stitch anticlockwise 9 repeat steps 5 to 8 until brim is one half_double_crochet width shy of completion pattern versioning 10 repeat steps 6 and 7 11 to join the two seams of the ribbed brim these should now be touching either sew or slip_stitch along two seams version date comments 0 1 08/05/2019 draft version for initial testing 0 2 09/05/2019 corrections/ enhancements from testing incorporated 0 3 20/05/2019 enhancements from baby beanie testing 4 optionally chain 2 instead of chain 1 this was preferred by some testers page | 11 beanie images image 1 image 25 image 5 image 6 image 3 image 4 acknowledgements thanks to the following fabulous testers for their effort commitment to the testing process attention to detail and helpful feedback provided chalyn m francine t julie l alysha b tracy m jenni o and michelle j 5 note the pictured v2 example beanie has one more round of solid double_crochet before commencing the first filet round and therefore has 20 rounds in total please follow the pattern instructions rather than the image your beanie will be 19 rounds total page | 12
